posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
I foresee privacy issues with usernames, thus I want to request a feature which I think negates the issues:

  1. Sometimes it might be desirable to post your username on a public website of forum, for example so customers can reach out to you. If you post your username on a public website or forum, anyone who knows your Signal username and throws that in a search engine could discover that website or forum.
  2. If we can only have one username at the time, we can’t chat with two people without a chance they find out they have been talking to the same person.

I think a better solution would be to allow users to have multiple throwaway usernames. You can hand out different usernames to different people, and keep using those names as long as you want. At any time you can delete one of your throwaway usernames and there will be no trace back to you.

Letting everyone create infinite usernames would obviously mean that many usernames will be taken. A solution for that could be to add numbers at the end of the throwaway usernames, like discord does, and allow every user to set one username at the time which does not have any numbers at the end. A public username, and infinite throwaway private usernames.

Just a thought to inspire the developers. The details are open to discussion.

posts.name: Steven
posts.cooked:
I think for disposable usernames you wouldn’t want a hash but actually something like giphy does might be more suitable for users who are putting in things by hand. What they do is have a dictionary and just smash words together. That’s much easier to type than random numbers, characters, and symbols. The dictionary shouldn’t need to be too big if they are 1 time use and have expiration dates on them (using them to just establish a connection. Can have hash in the background, we just need a key to initially connect. Contact would be “Anon_n” and hopefully you could change their name). The thing though is that you’d probably have to not respond to the sender that you have correctly or incorrectly messaged a user on the other end or you could do collisions and just run through the dictionary pretty quickly.

I really think the one time use names would also really help in reducing the username space.

Expanding on this: I’ll make a soft feature request aligned to this (not official because this isn’t even established or acknowledged), but have the ability to sort messages by the username you used. Which in this case would be: phone number, persistent username, one time use/anonymous names. Getting usernames it would still be useful to have the first two bins.

Thoughts?

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Looks like phone number privacy is coming soon, most likely that means we will be able to set a single username for ourselves and check a box ‘hide my phonenumber’. But with just one username, is it really that much more private?

The benefit of a username is that you can change it much easier than a phone number.

But there are a lot of privacy issue this does not solve. People who know your username can still go into groups to see if you are also a member there. They can still see which groups you have in common. And they can still ask others if they have also chatted with you.The reason: you are known under one username and obe username only. You use the same username with every contact and group on Signal. (And also the same profile image and profile name).

Signal is not meant for total anonimity, you will always have to register your app with your phone number or some other unique identifier, but unfortunatly Signal also doesn’t protect users from recognizing each other in groups.

The problem is having only one identity on Signal. Having a few like max 3 at the same time which you can delete at any time and make a new one could be a solution.

Reddit is an example of social media with allows multiple accounts, which allows for discussing topics which you would otherwise not feel free to discuss.

Meteor0id:

.The reason: you are known under one username and obe username only. You use the same username with every contact and group on Signal. (And also the same profile image and profile name).

Isn’t that technically the case anyway due to keeping the same UUID? I mean, it’s not user facing so the “average person” isn’t able to see that, but it would theoretically still be possible.

Technically it is. But for average user it makes some sense. This way you could be First name for your family and friends, more formal First Name Name for your work/business contacts and Nickname for some public groups/online acquaintances (ideally with different avatar for each contact group), etc.

posts.cooked:
Usernames are almost perfect the way they got implemented (Happily surprised!) But indeed I am still missing the ability to have say 3 usernames at the same time, so I can hand out different nanes to different people at the sane time. Why? Because for explample a joyrnalist might want to reach out to some sources as hinself, but to others under an alias to stay undercover. Not every chat is the same.

And ideally you would also habe multiple profiles (image, name, profile key) go make sure someone can’t later proof you are the same person that also talked to the other guy.

It’s about plausible deniability that you had a chat with a certain person.

Btw, Signal is also not yet deleting old contacts from the database so your own phone will give away anyone you ever chatted with. That too should get improved imo.
